page.title: 01ISLE OF LISMORE
page.content: { Lismore}is a long, low island in Loch Linnhe surrounded by sea and mountains.Its rock is{limestone}800 million years old.It is very green with hardly any heather and a huge variety of grasses and flowers. It has three castles and two new piers for boats from Oban and Appin. About{125}people live here, and their main job is{farming,}in which they have been successful enough to have stayed for many generations. Lismore had a{saint}called{Moluag, a contemporary of St.Columba,and his pastoral staff has been in the keeping of the same Lismore family for fourteen hundred years. Block{01840741}is in the middle of the island.The Land Cover and Amenity Counts apply to this section only, but the pages of text apply to the island as a whole.
